column4: http://xubuntulinux.blogspot.com/2006/07/ubuntu-set-correct-dpi-for-x-server.html
the second hack didn't really work for me
let me try the first one
it looks like it is a bug... but I wonder why it has not been fixed yet
what is it set to   96?
resolution:    129x127 dots per inch
fonts are too small
how do you find out   129 x 127?
xdpyinfo|grep resolution
mine says     resolution:    77x76 dots per inch
and my fonts are 96
yes, that is surely much more readable than mine
I wonder how I can change it
fonts can be changed in System>Pref>appearance
that is only for gnome
I want to change the dpi settings
for X
oh ok yes i'm using gnome
I am not..
what are you using?
kde at the moment. But that is not the point. I don't want it to work only for kde stuff...
